channel.title: CVE Feed for HostGator -- HostGator
channel.description: The latest CVEs for HostGator -- HostGator

item.title: CVE-2024-7208|2024-08-02T15:07:39.668Z -- hostgator -- hostgator
item.description: A vulnerability in multi-tenant hosting allows an authenticated sender to spoof the identity of a shared, hosted domain, thus bypass security measures provided by DMARC (or SPF or DKIM) policies.

item.title: CVE-2024-7208|2024-08-01T21:52:31.431Z -- hostgator -- hostgator
item.description: Hosted services do not verify the sender of an email against authenticated users, allowing an attacker to spoof the identify of another user's email address.

item.title: CVE-2024-7208|2024-07-30T17:02:05.962Z -- hostgator -- hostgator
item.description: Hosted services do not verify the sender of an email against authenticated users, allowing an attacker to spoof the identify of another user's email address.

item.title: CVE-2024-7208|2024-07-31T15:07:30.297Z -- hostgator -- hostgator
item.description: Hosted services do not verify the sender of an email against authenticated users, allowing an attacker to spoof the identify of another user's email address.

item.title: CVE-2024-7208|2024-08-02T14:26:46.187Z -- hostgator -- hostgator
item.description: Multi-tenant hosting providers do not verify the sender of an email against authenticated users, allowing an attacker to spoof the identify of another user's email address.
